problems.title: Matrix Chain Multiplication
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given N matrices A1, A2, ..., AN.
Matrix Ai has dimensions p[i-1] x p[i].

Find the minimum number of scalar multiplications needed to compute the product A1 × A2 × ... × AN.

The order of multiplication matters!
Matrix multiplication is associative: (A×B)×C = A×(B×C), but the cost differs.

Cost of multiplying matrix (a×b) with (b×c) = a × b × c.

DP State: dp[i][j] = min cost to multiply matrices from i to j.

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def matrixChainOrder(self, p):
        # TODO: dp[i][j] = min cost to multiply matrices i to j
        # Try all split points k: dp[i][j] = min(dp[i][k] + dp[k+1][j] + p[i-1]*p[k]*p[j])
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    import sys
    data = sys.stdin.read().strip().split('\n')
    n = int(data[0])
    p = list(map(int, data[1].split()))
    sol = Solution()
    print(sol.matrixChainOrder(p))

hintsList: Iterate by chain length L from 2 to n-1. For each start i, compute end j = i + L - 1.
For each pair (i,j), try all split points k from i to j-1: dp[i][j] = min(dp[i][k] + dp[k+1][j] + p[i-1]*p[k]*p[j]).
